qas.question: What is the concentration of copper in the earths crust.

context: Copper is synthesized in massive stars and is present in the Earth's crust at a concentration of about <a0_0><b5_0>50 parts per million<b5_0/><a0_0/> (ppm), where it occurs as native copper or in minerals such as the copper sulfides chalcopyrite and chalcocite, the copper carbonates azurite and malachite, and the copper(I) oxide mineral cuprite. The largest mass of elemental copper discovered weighed <a1_0><b6_0>420 tonnes<b6_0/><a1_0/> and was found in <a2_0><b7_0>1857<b7_0/><a2_0/> on the Keweenaw Peninsula in <a3_0><b8_0>Michigan, US<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Native copper is a polycrystal, with the largest described single crystal measuring <a4_0><b9_0>4.4×3.2×3.2 cm<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
